item.title: Why Python Matters
item.description: The debate regarding “R versus Python” is one that is largely based on statistics versus CS/ML. Each language has its own advantages however, we can conclude that both languages are very useful and can actually work together. Here are example of differences between R and Rython: After becoming very familiar with R all semester, learning about Python was quite interesting. We can use library(reticulate) to conduct some python coding in RStudio.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Inference, Prediction
item.description: I have decided to use the CrohnD dataset from the package robustbase. This dataset provides information regarding the number of adverse events caused by a drug used to treat patients sufferring from Crohns disease.This is dataset is composed of 117 observations on 9 variables: ID (patient identifcation number),nrAdvE (number of adverse events), BMI (Body MASS Index), height (in cm), country (a factor with levels 0 and 1),sex, age, weight (in kilograms) and finally treat (how CD was treated: a factor with levels 0, 1 and 2, meaning placebo, drug 1 and drug 2.

item.title: Project 1: Data Wrangling and Exploratory Analysis
item.description: Introduction: I will be using two different datasets from R-studio. The first dataset that I will be using is called bad_drivers. This dataset contains 51 observations and 8 variables. The 8 variables are num_drivers, perc_speeding (percent of drivers that were speeding), perc_alchol (percent of fatal collisons due to alcohol), perc_not_distracted (percent of drivers that were not distracted causing a fatal collison), perc_no_previous (percent of drivers with no previous fatal collisons), insurance_premiums, lossess (loss incured by insurance company).

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have recently completed: Exploratory Data Analysis with Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification
